title: Software Engineer - Payments Team
description:
**Software Engineer - Payments Team**



We're Policy Expert, a home and motor insurance provider and we're on a mission to shake up the personal insurance industry. We feel that insurers have under-served customers for too long with confusing policies, expensive renewals and frustrating claims processes. It is time to put customers first!



Since we formed in 2011, we've been using breakthrough thinking and proprietary tech to provide insurance that's clear, fair and great value. And people like what we do. So much so that we now have well over one million customers, driven by our double-digit growth. We also take great pride in having been the UK's No.1-rated home insurance provider for 9 years.



We have big aspirations. Our 'North Star' is 'To be the most successful insurance disruptor people want to stay with for life'. As we grow, we plan on continuing to challenge the norms of an insurance industry whose reputation for customer trust is low, where switching between providers is high and insurance cover is often seen as a costly 'grudge purchase'.



We aim to build longer and deeper relationships with our customers and to help them see insurance as being a help, not a hindrance.



Recently, we have been awarded an Outstanding 2 star accreditation and now rank within the Top 100 Best Large Companies 2023 to work for - https://www.b.co.uk/accreditation/2-star

  


**About our Payments team**



At Policy Expert, the Payments team stands at the forefront of financial technology and innovation in the insurance sector. We manage all aspects of card and bank account payments within our insurance website. Our focus is on creating secure, efficient, and user-friendly payment solutions that enhance customer experiences and drive our company's success in the market. We are a dedicated backend team that values Domain-Driven Design, Event Sourcing, and Event-Driven Design. Our transition towards Continuous Deployment is a testament to our commitment to agility and excellence, with daily deployments that constantly advance our capabilities.

  


**The role and what you'll be doing**



As a key member of the Payments team, you'll be diving into the core of payment processing systems and architecture. Here's what you'll focus on:


* Developing and refining our Java-based backend systems. You will spend most of your development time in Java apps with Groovy tests (written using Spock), dealing with intricate payment processing challenges.
* Engaging in light front-end development with TypeScript and React for our microfrontends and backend Lambda services, accounting for the remaining of your development time.
* Working within our comprehensive tech stack, which includes:  

	+ Containerised applications with Amazon ECS on AWS Fargate
	+ Serverless applications using API Gateway and Lambdas
	+ Event-driven architecture using SNS/SQS
	+ Storage with Postgres, DynamoDB and S3
	+ Orchestration with CloudFormation and GitHub Actions
* Collaborating closely with team members to ensure efficient, bug-free and frequent production releases.
* Applying practices such as Domain-Driven Design, Event Sourcing, and Event-Driven Design and Test-Driven Development to maintain high standards of code quality and system reliability.
* Solving complex payment-related problems through meticulous research and innovative solution development.

  


**What we are looking for**



We are in search of a Software Engineer who is not only technically skilled but also passionate about solving complex problems. The ideal candidate will possess:


* Strong experience in Java backend development, along with an understanding of its ecosystem
* Proficiency in writing high-quality unit tests, acceptance tests, and other forms of automated tests
* The ability to undertake detailed research to solve complex challenges
* Understanding of systems architecture and how to build scalable systems
* Excellent communication skills for effective teamwork and clear discussions with non-technical stakeholders
* A proactive approach in a dynamic, fast-evolving technical landscape
* Experience or willingness to adapt to continuous deployment and daily production deployments


Some nice to haves would be:


* Familiarity with our tech stack
* A solid grasp of Domain-Driven Design, Event Sourcing, and Event-Driven Design and Test-Driven Development
* Experience building products end-to-end. From ideation, to design, to implementation and support.
* Knowledge of TypeScript
* Knowledge of React
* Prior experience in the insurance or financial sector

  


**What we offer**



We want everyone to feel valued and rewarded in their work. We therefore offer all employees:


* Private medical cover with Vitality
* Dental Insurance
* Hybrid working
* Training and education through LinkedIn learning and Plurasight
* Travel season ticket loan
* Social events through the year
* Access to selected London O2 events and use of a Private Lounge.
* Employee Wellbeing Programme


We pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer. We treat all applications equally and recruit purely on the basis of an individual's skills, knowledge and experience. The quality and growing diversity of our people backs this up.

title: Software Developer
description:
Flexible Power Systems (FPS) is a Big Data and IoT enabled technology company that is removing barriers to van and truck fleet decarbonisation.

**The Role:**  
We are seeking a full-time Developer to work in our platform developments team on a series of classification, forecasting and optimisation tools that form part of a wider energy and logistics management platform FPS is developing for major grocery retailers.

The platform interfaces a wide range of devices like electric vehicle chargers, vehicle telematics and site metering as well as several client logistics systems (e.g. transport planning and warehouse management). The systems goal is to develop robust and optimal schedules for the client’s operations.

The role has considerable scope for development. You will from the start work with an experienced Senior Developer and DevOps Lead in addition to the analyst/innovation team to help update system components for functionality and scalability, propose solutions to new functional requirements as well as improving the company’s code production practices.

The role will require you to work closely with our analyst and innovation teams on:

* **Classification Models:** for application to journey and energy consumption data.
* **Forecasting Tools:** principally in relation to energy consumption of buildings and vehicles as well as some logistics processes.
* **Optimisation Tools Development:** in the fields of energy asset purchasing decision support and operations scheduling.
* **Developing and maintaining database operation:** FPS has a number of databases serving software platforms which feed longer term storage in a datalake.
* **Implementation –** working closely with DevOps and our IoT partners you will contribute to planning, development and test and of 3rd party interface access.

**Requirements:**  
The role requires substantial amounts of hands-on software development so at least 5 years’ experience of development in a professional context is essential.

Whilst we will provide training and support, essential skills include:

* Python coding
* Advanced database programming
* Database design
* Development for microservice and serverless architecture

Prior experience of the following is desirable:

* PostgreSQL
* MariaDB
* Azure Datalake / Blob storage
* Microsoft Azure or other comparable cloud products
* Java programming
* Optimisation Tool Libraries (e.g. CVXPY, PuLP, Fico Express)
* Github protocols and tools
* JIRA
* Confluence

Experience or interest in the following fields would be highly beneficial:

* Data science or data engineering
* Energy systems (vehicles, stationary, on and off grid)
* Logistics (warehousing, vehicles or retail environments)

**Further Details:**

* Salary grade for this role is £40-50k depending on experience and qualifications.
* The company operates a pension scheme that it contributes 3% of salary to your 5%.
* The company has an EMI share option scheme that the role would be eligible to participate in.
* Holiday entitlement is 25 days p.a. excluding bank holidays following probation.
* The Company’s offices are in Central London near Chancery Lane station though remote working is available to all staff on an ongoing basis.

**About the Company**

In the UK commercial vehicles account for around a third of transport emissions despite constituting only 12% of the fleet so they have to be tackled if we are to avoid dangerous climate change.

FPS works with some of the UK’s largest vehicle fleets on the challenge of replacing polluting diesel vehicles with zero emission alternatives. We have three products that support fleets looking to clean up.

* **fps plan** – a large scale simulation tool that allows operators to identify promising locations for electrification, test vehicle and charger choices and understand power and energy implications.
* **fps deploy** – specialist power electronics devices that help EVs fit customer operations
* **fps operate** – a platform that aggregates data from across our customers’ businesses to forecast requirements, monitors asset health and optimise and control fleet and charger operations in real time.

All of these offers have undergone proof of concept testing with target customers and we are now in the process of scaling our platforms and onboarding new customers

Please submit a CV and a covering letter. Submissions without a covering letter will not be considered.

Successful CVs will progress to interviews with FPS’s leadership team.

description:

HP deliver the world’s most secure PCs, engineered to protect the end user through hardware level security features. You’ll be joining the Virtualization Platforms group responsible for building hypervisors (Yes! We’re working on several VMM projects) and other operating system components. Our team has created a game-changing technology called micro-virtualization to protect end-users by isolating risky activities such as opening email attachments of unknown provenance in small, disposable Virtual Machines called uVMs. You can check out one of the snapshots of the uXen code base (our micro-virtualization hypervisor) in our public GitHub repo: https://github.com/uxen-virt/uxen. We’re also working on other advanced virtualization-based projects but let’s leave these to chat about “in person” if you’re interested.

* Lead design and implementation efforts with operating system level software projects such as device drivers with emphasis on virtualization and Windows kernel environments
* Lead reverse engineering and black box debugging efforts
* Provide solutions for macro and micro verification of the developed components

**Requirements for the Systems Software Developer:**

* Experience developing system software in C and x86 assembler
* Expert understanding of virtualization technologies, including hardware assisted virtualization (both VT-x and AMDV) and auxiliary technologies such as IO-MMU
* Expert understanding of modern operating systems
* Hands on experience with locating and addressing performance bottlenecks in system software

**A great Systems Software Developer will have-**

* Experience in modern C++ and/or Rust development

**#LI-Post**

**About you:**

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible- in your career as well as the world around you. So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

**About HP Wolf Security**


The primary focus of the HP Wolf Security team is developing cyber security solutions to protect our customers devices and data. The digital threat landscape is ever-changing and as the cyber security industry reacts and adapts to changes, so too do the malware authors. Our unique micro-virtualization technology ensures that customers are protected from even the most bleeding edge cyber security threats. That micro-virtualization technology forms a key pillar in a wider cyber security suite that we're actively developing.


To see what our engineering teams are working on, check out our technical blogs: https://threatresearch.ext.hp.com/blog

***Our history:***

*Inspired by the isolation principles of traditional virtualization, our team known then as Bromium, created a game-changing technology called micro-virtualization to protect end users against advanced malware. Every task the user performs, such as opening a document or clicking on a link, is isolated in its own micro-VM, with access to just the resources required for that task, and existing just for the life of the task. Protection is thus provided through isolation, without relying on detection, hence reliably defending the user from polymorphic and even zero-day malware.*

*Bromium was acquired by HP Inc on 19 September 2019 forming HP Wolf Security.*

*For more information, visit our website:* *https://www.hp.com/uk-en/security/endpoint-security-solutions.html*

**What does the job involve?**

As our Business Development Manager, you will operate with a high degree of independence. While we have systems in place, there's room for you to bring in your own ideas and improvements. As your sales thrive, you'll have the opportunity in the future to not only expand your team but also cultivate its growth.

You will:

* Craft sales campaigns that meet sales targets in collaboration with our business unit directors and marketing team for a coordinated strategy
* Devise strategies for sales outreach activities in geographical regions Collingwood is actively growing into e.g. the US, Europe and EMEA
* Nurture current relationships within our community and also create and execute strategies for new business development
* Attend events, create scripts, email outreach copy and undertake other activities that will contribute to the growth of Collingwood’s network of prospective clients
* Maintain sales records and design reports/dashboards to ensure that the data collected is being used effectively for decision making

* Identify opportunities by keeping track of competitor activity
* Communicate Collingwood’s value propositions and approach to value creation through proposals and pitch decks/presentations

We are looking for someone who has:

* Sales experience in professional services (such as business advisory, strategic management services, management consultancy, financial services or business information services)

* Knowledge of our market and competitors
* Outstanding persuasion, presentation and negotiation skills
* Knowledge of client retention and acquisition strategies
* Management experience, including ability to manage multiple projects and achieve sales targets
* Knowledge and experience of using of Hubspot or similar CRM

**Who is Collingwood?**

We advise the leaders of media companies.

We help them scale faster.

We help them sell or raise money.

We change their lives

Our team of experienced media leaders delivers high quality advice and support on strategy, planning, product development, sales, marketing, customer success and finance.

* We are media and information specialists, with experience in subscriptions, memberships, marketing services, publishing and events - both B2B and B2C
* We are dedicated to entrepreneurs, never acting for corporates or private equity firms
* We are active supporters of the Founder community:
* hosting a bi-annual global Media Entrepreneur Meetup with nearly 600 members
* producing Collingwood Insights, which provides roundtables, webinars and articles year-round

**Our values**

We continually score ourselves against our values through personal appraisals and regular client feedback sessions. This means that our team is very much aligned around what drives us:

**Pursue impact.** 

Because we believe in helping companies create more value, we always aim to deliver a tangible impact. We work with clear metrics, direction and defined purpose. We collaborate with companies for which we can make a difference.

**Demonstrate integrity.** 

Because we believe in doing right by leadership teams and their companies, we combine commercialism with a human touch. We’re honest and forthright in our actions. We distinguish between growing and selling a business, never pushing a client to exit.

**Champion curiosity.** 

Because we believe truly understanding a business is the starting point for making it better, we push ourselves and our clients to discover more. We are driven by the same entrepreneurial spirit as our clients. We ask the difficult questions that will bring about change. We listen to different perspectives.

**Adopt simplicity.**

Because we believe in being pragmatic and clear, we present ideas without clutter. We help leaders create the structures that allow them to work on their business – not be upended by it. We offer practical advice that moves our clients forward.

**Foster connection.**

Because we believe in being collaborative members of a community, we bring the wider industry together where we can. We learn from the expertise of others and share our own.
